itemDescription: Scottish soldier, military writer, and priest

wikipedia_page.main: George Robert Gleig (20 April 1796 – 9 July 1888) was a Scottish soldier, military writer, and priest.

response: The series of Colburn's Modern Standard Novelists (1835–41, 19 vols.), containing works by Thomas Campbell, Bulwer Lytton, Theodore Hook and Harrison Ainsworth, Lady Morgan, Robert Plumer Ward, Horace Smith, Marryat, Thomas Henry Lister, G. P. R. James, and George Robert Gleig. Colburn also numbered among "my authors" Disraeli, John Banim, and fashionable novelists of the day.
